intro: Leucanthemum coronopifolium subsp. ceratophylloides, commonly known as the starry groundsel, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. It produces a capsule fruit containing numerous tiny seeds. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many flowering plants with composite flower heads.
